text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kitaguchi was born in Osaka Prefecture on March 8, 1935. After graduating from Kwansei Gakuin University, he joined Mitsubishi Motors in 1957. In 1965, Mitsubishi Motors joined new league Japan Soccer League. He retired in 1966. He played 4 games in the league. In 1956, when Kitaguchi was a Kwansei Gakuin University student, he was selected the Japan national team for 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, but he did not play in the match.Japan Football Association In May 1958, he was selected Japan for 1958 Asian Games. At this competition, on May 26, he debuted against Philippines. He played 10 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 1959. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1958||3||1 |- |1959||7||0 |- !Total||10||1 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1935 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Osaka Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds players Category:Footballers at the 1956 Summer Olympics
title: Akira Kitaguchi
